data.title: We love their burgers
data.text: This In-N-Out has been here for many years. There are two drive thru lanes, and a walk up window. We always drive thru and get our food and then go park someplace and enjoy our food. You can't go wrong with these fresh hamburgers and fresh cut fries.

data.title: Favorite burger
data.text: This is my favorite burger of all time - Double double! This location did not disappoint. I customize my burger by requesting no onions or tomato and I ask for the meat to be cooked well done. They prepared it perfectly!

data.title: Best burgers!
data.text: This In n Out is spotless.  They are well organized and efficient.  The burgers are always flavorful and nice and juicy, never dry.  The french fries are excellent and one order easily feeds two people.

data.title: The best!
data.text: In-n-Out burgers are the best!  Never dry or soggy, they are always juicy and full of flavor.  The fries are also good and they give you a huge portion.

data.title: Predominant Burger Joint on the West Coast
data.text: As soon as we arrived to LA the first stop was In-N-Out Burger because there are rave reviews about it Country-wide. The burgers are good, fries are decent - Mcdonald's has better. Service is kind of slow probably because they have a tiny kitchen crammed with 5 people. But the place stays busy, so much so they have to get out and direct traffic. The best part about this place is the prices, you can get an entire meal for about $6.00. If you're in California you have to try it out.

data.title: Can't resist In-N-Out
data.text: There isn't a better hamburger in town. Must get a double as the meat is very thin. I love to get it with lettuce. We've been eating at this place since we moved here 28 yrs ago. Always a crowd at the drive thru but worth the wait. There are a few tables, but outside.

data.title: Best burgers in SoCal!
data.text: Best burgers, my favorite is with grilled onions and pickles. Their shakes are also delicious... try a neapolitan.

data.title: In-n-Out Tasty
data.text: Every In-n-Out Burger has the same quality burgers, always pretty quick service.  But the drive thru in Norwalk gets backed up into the street, so be careful.  This facility has no inside seating.

data.title: Mmmmmm tasty
data.text: I love eating here. I've eaten at in and our burger since the 80's. There in always a long if you go through the drive thru, but it's worth the wait.

data.title: My "Grilled Cheese" Experience
data.text:
I was visiting with a local and I had heard rave reviews about "In 'N Out Burger".

Off we went. I don't eat red meat anymore but my companion does.
She remembered that they offered a grilled cheese sandwich, though it wasn't listed on the menu board.

When she asked if they had anything other than burgers, the guy replied "yes we have a delicious grilled cheese". Great! When we ordered it, we were asked if we wanted onions on it. Em, no thanks.

The "Grilled Cheese" sandwich is a burger without the meat. That's it.
It wasn't bad, the people were nice, but it isn't a grilled cheese. 
Like I said, it's a hamburger bun with lettuce, cheese, a tomato slice,  along with 1,000 island dressing or the like.

It seems people rave about the fries. Though I saw them using a machine to cut potatoes into little fries, I didn't detect any real difference between these and any other fast-food joint.

I'm sure the burgers are good, but what I ate was NOT a grilled cheese sandwich.
